subject: Self Care
title: Self-Compassion in Relationships
description: A quick win: understand Self-Compassion in Relationships.

hook.text: He snapped at his partner after a bad day. Instead of spiraling into guilt, he said 'I'm stressed and I'm sorry.'

buildup.text: Self-compassion in relationships means owning your mistakes without self-destruction. Accountability without shame.

discovery.text: Research shows self-compassionate partners are more emotionally available, less defensive, and better at repairing conflict.

twist.text: People expect self-compassion to make you selfish in relationships. It actually makes you more generous and present.

climax.text: After a relational misstep: acknowledge the impact, forgive yourself, and repair quickly. Self-attack delays repair.

punchline.text: Self-compassion makes you a better partner, not a selfish one.

quiz.question: How does self-compassion affect romantic relationships?
options: Self-compassionate partners are more available and better at repair
It has no effect on relationships
